Job Description

Job Title: Scientist III, R&D
Requisition ID: 69071BR


Location:
Santa Clara, CA

How will you make an impact?

Join our team creating the next generation of genomic technologies for Reproductive Health research. When youre part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, youll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and youll be supported in achieving your career goals.

What will you do?

  • Design and conduct laboratory experiments for developing new molecular genetics/genomics products.
  • Work within cross-functional new-product introduction teams to drive feasibility, development, and verification and validation of complex genomic technologies..
  • Development and transfer sustainable and scalable manufacturing and quality control processes to a production environment.
  • Manage and maintain required laboratory reagents (reference samples, assay buffers, and labeling reagents, etc.) and equipment needed to carry out projects.
  • Actively participate in meetings and assist other project teams to resolve technical/operational issues and/or provide support.
How will you get here?
Education:
  • B.S. in Biological or Chemical sciences required. M.S. or Ph.D. preferred.
Experience:
  • Minimum of 6 years post-baccalaureate research experience required.
  • Experience in new product development and commercialization.
  • Extensive experience in laboratory molecular biology, genomics, biochemistry, or similar field.
  • Experience in next generation sequencing, qPCR, digital PCR, microarrays, and laboratory automation.
  • Familiarity with bioinformatics, analysis of high-content data sets, and statistical principles.
  • Familiarity with project management best practices.

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:
  • Think creatively, plan quickly, and act effectively.
  • Be an action-oriented R&D expert within a fast-paced research team.
  • Manage progress of multiple projects in parallel, at times as project lead.
  • Communicate effectively with representatives of R&D, project and product management, bioinformatics, manufacturing, and leadership.
  • Maintain a positive mindset, open to continuous improvement.



At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 65,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular missionenabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.

Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.com
